definition:
Signal for patterns suggestive of high-control group formation,
   radicalization pipelines, or intense identity lock-in.

positive_examples: Members should cut ties with outsiders who don't understand our truth.
Only our leader has access to the real knowledge.
Questioning the doctrine shows you haven't truly committed.
Once you're in, leaving means abandoning everything that matters.
We are the chosen ones who see what others cannot.
negative_examples: It's healthy to maintain diverse relationships and perspectives.
Good organizations encourage questions and critical thinking.
Leadership should be accountable and open to challenge.
Commitment to a community shouldn't require isolation.
Different people can hold different views reasonably.
training_hints.disambiguation: Detects high-control group patterns versus healthy community. Key markers: isolation, exclusive truth, questioning = disloyalty, leader worship, us vs them.
